description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 1000), calculate the sum of the first n prime numbers and then return the sum of the digits of that result.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the sum of the digits of the sum of the first n prime numbers.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 10000), find the nth Fibonacci number. Then, return the sum of its digits.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the sum of the digits of the nth Fibonacci number.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 500), calculate the sum of the first n triangular numbers. Return the product of its digits.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the product of the digits of the sum of the first n triangular numbers.

description: Given a list of integers, find the largest continuous subarray sum. Return the number of even digits in that sum.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the number of even digits in the largest continuous subarray sum.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 100), find the nth number in the sequence defined as: a(n) = a(n-1) * a(n-2) + 1, a(1) = 1, a(2) = 2. Return the sum of its digits.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the sum of the digits of the nth number in the sequence.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 200), calculate the product of the first n even numbers. Return the sum of its odd digits.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the sum of the odd digits of the product of the first n even numbers.

description: Given a list of integers, find the smallest continuous subarray product. Return the number of prime digits in that product.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the number of prime digits in the smallest continuous subarray product.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 150), determine the nth number in the sequence defined as: a(n) = 2*a(n-1) - a(n-2) + 3, a(1) = 2, a(2) = 5. Return its last digit.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the last digit of the nth number in the sequence.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 300), calculate the sum of the squares of the first n odd numbers. Return the product of its even digits.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the product of the even digits of the sum of the squares of the first n odd numbers.

description: Given a list of positive integers, find the largest sum obtained by adding exactly three numbers. Return the number of odd digits in that sum.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the number of odd digits in the largest sum of three numbers.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 120), find the nth number in the sequence defined as: a(n) = 3*a(n-1) + a(n-2) - 2, a(1) = 3, a(2) = 8. Return its last digit.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the last digit of the nth number in the sequence.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 400), compute the sum of the cubes of the first n even numbers. Return the sum of its prime digits.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the sum of the prime digits of the sum of the cubes of the first n even numbers.

description: Given a list of integers, determine the smallest product obtained by multiplying exactly four numbers. Return the number of prime digits in that product.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the number of prime digits in the smallest product of four numbers.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 140), determine the nth number in the sequence defined as: a(n) = 2*a(n-2) - a(n-1) + 5, a(1) = 4, a(2) = 7. Return its last digit.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the last digit of the nth number in the sequence.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 450), calculate the product of the squares of the first n prime numbers. Return the sum of its even digits.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the sum of the even digits of the product of the squares of the first n prime numbers.

description: Given a list of positive integers, determine the largest difference between any two numbers. Return the number of even digits in that difference.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the number of even digits in the largest difference between any two numbers.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 160), find the nth number in the sequence defined as: a(n) = 3*a(n-2) - 2*a(n-1) + 6, a(1) = 5, a(2) = 8. Return its last digit.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the last digit of the nth number in the sequence.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 500), compute the sum of the cubes of the first n even numbers. Return the product of its odd digits.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the product of the odd digits of the sum of the cubes of the first n even numbers.

description: Given a list of integers, determine the second largest element in the list. Return the sum of the digits of this element.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the sum of the digits of the second largest element in the list.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 170), identify the nth number in the sequence defined as: a(n) = 4*a(n-1) - a(n-2) + 7, a(1) = 6, a(2) = 9. Return its last digit.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the last digit of the nth number in the sequence.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 550), calculate the product of the squares of the first n odd numbers. Return the sum of its even digits.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the sum of the even digits of the product of the squares of the first n odd numbers.

description: Given a list of positive integers, find the smallest element in the list that is greater than the average of all elements. Return the product of its digits.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the product of the digits of the smallest element greater than the average of all elements.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 180), identify the nth number in the sequence defined as: a(n) = 5*a(n-2) - 3*a(n-1) + 8, a(1) = 7, a(2) = 10. Return its last digit.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the last digit of the nth number in the sequence.

output: A single integer, representing the product of the prime digits of the sum of the fourth powers of the first n prime numbers.

description: Given a list of integers, determine the second smallest element in the list. Return the sum of the digits of this element squared.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the sum of the digits of the square of the second smallest element in the list.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 190), determine the nth number in the sequence defined as: a(n) = 6*a(n-1) - 2*a(n-2) + 9, a(1) = 8, a(2) = 11. Return its first digit.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the first digit of the nth number in the sequence.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 650), determine the nth number in the sequence defined as: a(n) = 30*a(n-1) - 26*a(n-2) + 33, a(1) = 32, a(2) = 35. Return its last digit.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the last digit of the nth number in the sequence.

description: Given an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 1850), compute the sum of the first n odd prime numbers. Return the product of its prime digits.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the product of the prime digits of the sum of the first n odd prime numbers.

description: Given a list of positive integers, find the element that appears exactly nine times in the list. Return the sum of the digits of this element to the eighth power.  Write a function named solve to accomplish this task.
output: A single integer, representing the sum of the digits of the element raised to the eighth power that appears exactly nine times.
